jparsec.ephem.planets.imcce

Class Vsop

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.planets.imcce.Vsop

  • public class Vsop
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides VSOP planetary positions for Mercury through Neptune. The version of VSOP implemeted is VSOP87A (J2000 heliocentric rectangular coordinates). Bretagnon P., Francou G., : 1988, Astron. Astrophys., 202, 309.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Method Detail

      • getHeliocentricEclipticPositionJ2000

        public static double[] getHeliocentricEclipticPositionJ2000(double JD,
                                            Target.TARGET planet)
                                                     throws JPARSECException
        Obtain rectangular position of a planet using full VSOP87 theory. Mean equinox and ecliptic J2000.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        planet - Planet ID.
        Returns:
        Array (x, y, z, vx, vy, vz).
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • getGeocentricPosition

        public static double[] getGeocentricPosition(double JD,
                             Target.TARGET planet,
                             double light_time,
                             boolean addSat,
                             ObserverElement obs)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Get rectangular ecliptic geocentric position of a planet in equinox J2000.
        Parameters:
        JD - Julian day in TDB.
        planet - Planet ID.
        light_time - Light time in days.
        addSat - True to add the planetocentric position of the satellite to the position of the planet.
        obs - The observer object. Can be null for the Earth's center.
        Returns:
        Array with x, y, z, vx, vy, vz coordinates. Note velocity components are those for the Earth (used for aberration correction) not those for the planet relative to the geocenter.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • vsopEphemeris

        public static EphemElement vsopEphemeris(TimeElement time,
                         ObserverElement obs,
                         EphemerisElement eph)
                                  throws JPARSECException
        Calculate planetary positions, providing full data. This method uses full VSOP87A theory from the IMCCE.

        Typical difference respect DE200 is below 0.01 arcseconds during the 21st century, and below 1" (compared to JPL DE403 Ephemeris) for inner planets outside this century. It is not recommended to use VSOP87 for giant planets before 1900 or after 2100, despite that the results match JPL DE200 Ephemeris to within the arcsecond for several millenia. Results closer to JPL DE403 can be obtained with JPL ephemeris or Moshier algorithms.

        Parameters:
        time - Time object containing the date.
        obs - Observer object containing the observer position.
        eph - Ephemeris object with the target and ephemeris properties.
        Returns:
        Ephem object containing ephemeris data. Rise, set, transit times and maximum elevation fields are not computed in this method, use Ephem class for that.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - Thrown if the calculation fails.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        For unit testing only.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
